content.description: Great hands, great feet. Pinchable chunks for rock in between a 1 foot crack. Most climbers should be able to reach the tops of the pinches and use them as jugs. Well spaced jugs with good feet for the top out.
content.protection: Crash pads and spotters. Rocks below problem are not perfectly flat. This is in the northern side of the area.
content.location: This is in the northern side of the area.

content.description: Start on the crimp line to 1-2 more crimps to get you to the first horizontal crack line. Get feet up to reach up for the top or deadpoint.Top out.
content.protection:
Crash pads and a spotter.  

  There is a foot wide ledge 1 foot above the rest of the ground. This makes it hard to place the crash pad well. Two crash pads definitely will feet a lot safer if the problem is at your limit or if you are short. If you roll backwards after falling, you may land in a puddle of stagnant water.
content.location: To the left of teacher's pet and back to basics start on the crimps 4-5 feet off of the ground.

content.description: Traverse the northern side of the wall from left to right starting on the crimps and top out right.

Begin on the opening that is located on the 3rd crack in from the edge (sits below two layers of rock -- there are two. Start on the one to the right). Work you way up and left towards the cube, then traverse to the crack located to the left of "Easy A". Top out on the slabs sticking out of that crack. Crux is the section before you reach and pass "Easy A" (crimps).
content.location: On the far-right side of the south-facing wall. Water on your right-hand side when facing the wall. Near a good area to walk down to School House.

content.description: Climb from horizontal crack to horizontal crack to top out above the start.
content.location: Towards the right end of the northern wall.

content.description: Use juggy edges in the dihedral to make your way up to top out on the lower ledge to the left
Traverse starting near the entrance of the school house. Start in the center of the southern side and traverse left. Top out.
content.protection: Spotters and a crash pad. The fall could be sketchy due to the small ledges

content.description: Climb the small sized crack on the face immediately right of teachers pet to the top out.

This traverse starts right below the easiest way to climb/scramble down into the school house. The traverse is a sit start at the left ledge and finishes by topping out in the middle of the two long walls.
The top out is the most challenging part of the climb, but is not much harder than the rest of the climb. Get feet high enough to reach the jug. Top out to the right.
content.protection: Crash pad and spotters are required
content.location: The route is between Thinking Cap and Teacher's Pet. Start on the jug/pinch about 5 feet from the ground.

content.description:
This is a secluded area with a few easy problems. The problems exist within a small slot in the rocks. There will still be some puddles. 

  There are easy problems great for introducing a new climber to outdoor climbing for the first time with easy top outs.  

  This area might be dry enough even when Monument Cove is still wet. 

  It is possible that this area already has a name as well as names for the boulder problems. Let me know so I can update appropriately I just wanted people to be able to find it.
